== UIBinder UIBinder allows to design GWT UI's declarative via XML. Create a new GWT project "de.vogella.gwt.uibinder" with the package "de.vogella.gwt.uibinder". To use UIBinder you also need to inherit from "com.google.gwt.uibinder.UiBinder" in your "gwt.xml" file.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="../examples/uibinder/De_vogella_gwt_uibinder.gwt.xml[] ----
In your client package create the file "HelloWidgetWorld.ui.xml".
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="../examples/uibinder/HelloWidgetWorld.ui.xml[] ----
Create the following class which uses the xml file for building actions. By convention the name of the xml must equal to the class name + "ui.xml".
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="../examples/uibinder/HelloWidgetWorld.java[] ----
Create also in the client package the file "MyHTMLTable.ui.xml" This creates a HTML Panel which allow us to layout the UI controls nicely.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="../examples/uibinder/MyHTMLTable.ui.xml[] ----
Create the corresponding "MyHTMLTable.java" file.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="../examples/uibinder/MyHTMLTable.java[] ----
In your entry point you can now load the class as an composite.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="../examples/uibinder/De_vogella_gwt_uibinder.java[] ----
